name: AccessibilityFocusState
desc: A property wrapper type that can read and write a value that SwiftUI updates as the focus of any active accessibility technology, such as VoiceOver, changes.

items.name: init<T>()
items.desc: Creates a new accessibility focus state of the type you provide.

items.name: init()
items.desc: Creates a new accessibility focus state for a Boolean value.

items.name: init<T>(for: AccessibilityTechnologies)
items.desc: Creates a new accessibility focus state of the type and using the accessibility technologies you specify.

items.name: init(for: AccessibilityTechnologies)
items.desc: Creates a new accessibility focus state for a Boolean value, using the accessibility technologies you specify.

items.name: var projectedValue: AccessibilityFocusState<Value>.Binding
items.desc: A projection of the state value that can be used to establish bindings between view content and accessibility focus placement.

items.name: var wrappedValue: Value
items.desc: The current state value, taking into account whatever bindings might be in effect due to the current location of focus.
